alert.note: Alert for Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued April 25 at 7:27PM MDT until April 26 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...HEAVY SNOW INTO EARLY WEDNESDAY... .A winter storm will bring heavy snow to the Front Range mountains and foothills through Wednesday morning. The heaviest snowfall will be in the mountains and foothills west and southwest of Denver this evening into the early morning hours. Storm total snowfall amounts up to 2 feet are expected for most of the Front Range mountains and upper elevations of the foothills. Snowfall rates of 2 inches per hour will be possible during the heavier snowfall, and travel will likely be very difficult during this period. Snow levels will lower this evening, with periods of heavy snow likely on I-25 between Castle Rock and Colorado Springs. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow ongoing. Additional snow accumulations between 1 and 6 inches. * WHERE...Castle Rock. * WHEN...Until Noon MDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel may become very difficult to impossible due to heavy snowfall on roadways. Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the Wednesday morning commute.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for Colorado can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by going to www.cotrip.org. Persons should consider delaying all travel. If travel is absolutely necessary, drive with extreme caution. Consider taking a winter storm kit along with you, including such items as tire chains, booster cables, flashlight, shovel, blankets and extra clothing. Also take water, a first aid kit, and anything else that would help you survive in case you become stranded.
